alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:44PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wayne, southwestern Laurel, southwestern Bell, southwestern Knox, southeastern Pulaski, McCreary and Whitley Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 744 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Grove to near Zula. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Rye, Deering, Grove, Bark Camp, Barton, Youngs Creek, Vox, Holly Bay Rec. Area, Keavy and North Corbin around 750 PM EDT. Faber, Walden, Woodbine, Moore Hill, Clio and Goldbug around 755 PM EDT. Williamsburg, Rockholds, Mount Pisgah, Wilton, Wofford and Burfield around 800 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Perkins, Indian Creek, Parmleysville, Julip, Dishman Springs, Lucky, Suttons Mill, Yaden, Griffin, Gausdale, Clate, Permon, King, Great Meadows Campsites, Louden, Swan Lake, Swanpond, Verne, Dixie, Birdseye, Bryants Store, Hubbs, Goins, Carpenter, Siler, Myrick, Brush Creek, Avis, Gatliff, Wheeler, Kayjay, Trosper, Frakes, Pearl, Davisburg, Chenoa, Ingram, Fonde and Pruden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne; Whitley
